title: 20th Anniversary event

properties.name: description
properties.value: The 20th Anniversary event was the celebration the 20th anniversary of RuneScape. The event involved helping a green Gnome Child who had been accidentally summoned by Wizard Grayzag to return to the Realm of Memories.

content:
"Anniversary" redirects here. For a list of Old School RuneScape birthday events, see Birthday event.
20th Anniversary event
Released 6 January 2021 (Update)
End date 27 January 2021 (Update)
Reward 20th Anniversary Outfit
Preceded by N/A
Succeeded by N/A

The 20th Anniversary event was the celebration the 20th anniversary of RuneScape. The event involved helping a green Gnome Child who had been accidentally summoned by Wizard Grayzag to return to the Realm of Memories.

During the event, several of the cities across Gielinor were decorated in their centres with lines of flags, and several boxes of fireworks, as well as some banners showing the number 20, celebrating the 20-year anniversary.

Contents

  • 1 Walkthrough
  • 2 Rewards
  • 3 Transcript
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 References

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

 This article or section is incomplete and could do with improvement.
Reason: Ignorant of Miss Schism's role in the event when the Wise Old Man is away from home during the Swan Song quest.
You can discuss this issue on the talk page or edit this article to improve it.

Items required: shears. Recommended: Necklace of Passage, Lumbridge Teleport, Draynor Manor Teleport and Explorer's ring 2 or higher.

To start the event, speak to Wizard Grayzag in the Wizards' Tower. He will ask you to run an errand for him. He is trying to expand his imp army to include more demons like the one in the cage next to him. In his attempts, he accidentally created a portal to the Realm of Memories instead of a time travelling portal, which made the Gnome Child appear. Talk to the Gnome Child, and he will explain that he needs to collect some artefacts of RuneScape's history, and you need to guide him to the places where he can find them. Agree to help him in his journey, and he will tell you to go to the Wise Old Man first to get his Blue partyhat.

Note: if you move away too far away from the featured locations in this event, the gnome child will return to the Wizards' Tower, and you would need to return to the Wizards' Tower to get the Gnome child back. To avoid losing the Gnome Child, stay on the ground floor, within the circle of the Wizards' Tower, the Falador farm, Draynor Manor, and Lumbridge Castle. Losing the Gnome Child (it will return to the Wizards' Tower) will occur by taking part in most random events, using the minigame teleport, or teleporting to your player owned house. Note: If you lose the Gnome Child, your progress will be safe.

Make your way to the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village and ask him if you can have his Blue Partyhat. The gnome child will convince him that times have changed since he stole it in the Draynor Bank Robbery. The Wise Old Man then agrees and claims to have plenty of spares anyway. The gnome child then tells you to visit Hans, who is walking around the Lumbridge Castle, to obtain a navigational chart. Talk to Hans, and without needing much convincing, he will give you the chart, which pops up as an interface. This interface can simply be closed to move on to the next step.

The cookbook as used by the Lumbridge Cook during Cook's Assistant.

Enter the Lumbridge Castle and talk to the Cook to ask him for his recipe book. The cook will complain about several things that make his life inconvenient, such as not having a Grand Exchange in Lumbridge, his food burning, and some other "quality of life" changes. After this rant, the cook will agree to give the gnome his recipe book, since he knows the recipe by heart now, even though he never successfully baked a cake in his life. The gnome child then tells you to go to Bob in his axe shop.

Walk to the axe shop and talk to Bob to ask him for his autograph. Bob shows his aversion to anything that's not a human, and responds by saying he normally doesn't serve 'his kind' in his shop. The gnome child will then praise Bob for his heroic deeds such as defeating the Dragonkin, confusing the axe salesman with Bob the Jagex Cat. If you then try to explain this is the wrong Bob, the gnome starts talking about a conspiracy theory, asking if it is just a coincidence that this man has the same name. Even if you insist on this being a coincidence, the gnome child still wants the autograph. Bob will sign a flyer and hands one to the gnome child, and gives you one as well. This flyer may be dropped right away.

The next step is The Thing in Fred the Farmer's sheep pen. The gnome explains that initially, Fred talked about 'The Thing' being in his sheep pen, without there actually being any mysterious creature. But then, after the release of the Cold War quest, there suddenly was a weird creature, and it was even given a purpose. Because of the long history this fake sheep has had, it has historical significance, so the gnome child needs you to shear some wool using shears. Attempt to shear the fake sheep with the gnome following you to actually succeed in shearing just a small bit, before the Thing flees from you.

The next artefact is a feather from Ernest, from when he was a chicken. Visit Draynor Manor, go up the stairs, then up the spiral stairs to the west. In the eastern room, take the 'odd feathers' lying next to the strange machine, or pluck the chicken if you have not completed Ernest the Chicken. You will obtain a feather, which you hand to the Gnome Child. To leave the manor, you can go out the eastern door on the ground floor. Talk to the gnome (right click) and he will tell you he needs a cabbage from the Falador cabbage patch. From the early days of RuneScape, the cabbage has been renowned as a "wondrous source of brassican goodness", so the gnome child will need a freshly picked one to use as an artefact.

Go to the Falador cabbage patch (you can use the teleport of the Explorer's ring 2 or higher for this without losing the gnome) and pick a cabbage. The gnome will take the cabbage (if not, make sure you talk to the gnome). Attempting to pick a cabbage from the Draynor patch triggers dialogue where the gnome child states he doesn't want that one. Talk to the gnome again, and he will tell you he has everything. Return to the Wizards' Tower to complete reopening the portal to the Realm of Memories. Speak to the gnome, and he will chant mysteriously to reopen the portal. After finishing the dialogue, you will step into the portal and get greeted by the gnome child, who will give you the event rewards. Feel free to look around in the realm and see several old graphics of monsters from the early days of RuneScape 2.

Congratulations! Event complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 20th anniversary outfit
  • Gnome child mask
  • Gnome child icon
  • 2 noted Half full wine jug
  • All previous birthday event rewards:
    • Cat ears
    • Birthday cake
    • Prop sword
    • Cow outfit
    • War ship
    • Gnome child hat
    • 4th birthday hat
    • Birthday balloons
    • Crazy dance emote
    • Smooth dance emote
  • Museum Medley music track unlock

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on an event has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations encountered throughout the event.

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • The gnome child appearing on the login splash screen with a normal skin tone instead of green.

  • The Wizards' Tower during the event.

  • The entrance to Lumbridge Castle during the event.

  • The castle courtyard during the event.

  • Varrock Square during the event.

  • East Falador during the event.

  • The Party Room during the event.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Players who have completed Swan Song will protest to the Wise Old Man giving away his partyhat so easily to the Gnome Child, saying that he didn't want to give the player his partyhat. The Wise Old Man will reply that he still might have held a more sentimental value to the party hat at that time.
    • Players who have partially completed Swan Song will not even see the Wise Old Man, instead talking to someone nearby to get the hat, which is not even the same hat that was stolen.
  • Varying dialogue is also shown depending on the player's participation in 2017 Christmas event, A Tail of Two Cats, Cook's Assistant, Cold War, Dragon Slayer II and Ernest the Chicken.
  • Despite being green in the event, the Gnome Child appears as normal on the login splash screen.
  • The decorations in a few cities featured a single post that was examinable, with the examine text "What am I examining posts for?". This was done as a reference to commonly found posts in RuneScape Classic,[1] giving the same examine text. The other posts present in these cities were not be examinable.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 17 January 2021. (Archived from the original on 17 January 2021.) Mod Ash: ""That is the message you'd receive if you examined a lot of posts in RS Classic - we added it in a few places for this event, for those who have been around long enough to recognise the message.""

[[File:20th Anniversary event - Banner.png|left|120px]]
The '''20th Anniversary event''' was the celebration the 20th anniversary of ''[[RuneScape]]''. The event involved helping a green [[Gnome Child]] who had been accidentally summoned by [[Wizard Grayzag]] to return to the [[Realm of Memories]].

During the event, several of the cities across [[Gielinor]] were decorated in their centres with lines of flags, and several boxes of [[fireworks]], as well as some banners showing the number 20, celebrating the 20-year anniversary.

==Walkthrough==
{{Incomplete|Ignorant of [[Miss Schism]]'s role in the event when the [[Wise Old Man]] is away from home during the [[Swan Song]] quest.}}
''Items required: [[shears]]. Recommended: [[Necklace of Passage]], [[Lumbridge Teleport]], [[Draynor Manor Teleport]] and [[Explorer's ring 2]] or higher.''

[[File:Gnome Child chathead.png|left]]

To start the event, speak to [[Wizard Grayzag]] in the [[Wizards' Tower]]. He will ask you to run an errand for him. He is trying to expand his [[imp]] army to include more [[Lesser demon|demons]] like the one in the cage next to him. In his attempts, he accidentally created a portal to the [[Realm of Memories]] instead of a time travelling portal, which made the [[Gnome Child]] appear. Talk to the Gnome Child, and he will explain that he needs to collect some artefacts of ''RuneScape''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s history, and you need to guide him to the places where he can find them. Agree to help him in his journey, and he will tell you to go to the [[Wise Old Man]] first to get his [[Blue partyhat]].

'''Note:''' if you move away too far away from the featured locations in this event, the gnome child will return to the [[Wizards' Tower]], and you would need to return to the Wizards' Tower to get the Gnome child back. To avoid losing the Gnome Child, stay on the ground floor, within the circle of the Wizards' Tower, the [[Falador farm]], [[Draynor Manor]], and [[Lumbridge Castle]]. Losing the Gnome Child (it will return to the Wizards' Tower) will occur by taking part in most [[random event]]s, using the minigame teleport, or teleporting to your player owned house. '''Note: If you lose the Gnome Child, your progress will be safe.'''

Make your way to the [[Wise Old Man]] in [[Draynor Village]] and ask him if you can have his [[Blue Partyhat]]. The gnome child will convince him that times have changed since he stole it in the [[Draynor Bank Robbery]]. The Wise Old Man then agrees and claims to have plenty of spares anyway. The gnome child then tells you to visit [[Hans]], who is walking around the [[Lumbridge Castle]], to obtain a navigational chart. Talk to Hans, and without needing much convincing, he will give you the chart, which pops up as an interface. This interface can simply be closed to move on to the next step.
[[File:Lumbridge Cook recipe book.png|thumb|right|The cookbook as used by the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Lumbridge Cook]] during [[Cook's Assistant]].]]
Enter the [[Lumbridge Castle]] and talk to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] to ask him for his recipe book. The cook will complain about several things that make his life inconvenient, such as not having a [[Grand Exchange]] in [[Lumbridge]], his food burning, and some other "quality of life" changes. After this rant, the cook will agree to give the gnome his recipe book, since he knows the recipe by heart now, even though he never successfully baked a cake in his life. The gnome child then tells you to go to [[Bob]] in his [[Bob's Brilliant Axes.|axe shop]].

Walk to the axe shop and talk to Bob to ask him for his autograph. Bob shows his aversion to anything that's not a human, and responds by saying he normally doesn't serve 'his kind' in his shop. The gnome child will then praise Bob for his heroic deeds such as defeating the [[Dragonkin]], confusing the axe salesman with [[Bob  (cat)|Bob the Jagex Cat]]. If you then try to explain this is the wrong Bob, the gnome starts talking about a conspiracy theory, asking if it is just a coincidence that this man has the same name. Even if you insist on this being a coincidence, the gnome child still wants the autograph. Bob will sign a [[flyer]] and hands one to the gnome child, and gives you one as well. This flyer may be dropped right away.

The next step is [[Sheep (penguins)|The Thing]] in [[Fred the Farmer]]'s sheep pen. The gnome explains that initially, Fred talked about 'The Thing' being in his sheep pen, without there actually being any mysterious creature. But then, after the release of the [[Cold War]] quest, there suddenly was a weird creature, and it was even given a purpose. Because of the long history this fake sheep has had, it has historical significance, so the gnome child needs you to shear some wool using [[shears]]. Attempt to shear the fake sheep with the gnome following you to actually succeed in shearing just a small bit, before the Thing flees from you.

The next artefact is a feather from [[Ernest]], from when he was a chicken. Visit [[Draynor Manor]], go up the stairs, then up the spiral stairs to the west. In the eastern room, take the 'odd feathers' lying next to the strange machine, or pluck the chicken if you have not completed [[Ernest the Chicken]]. You will obtain a feather, which you hand to the [[Gnome Child]]. To leave the manor, you can go out the eastern door on the ground floor. Talk to the gnome (right click) and he will tell you he needs a cabbage from the [[Falador farm|Falador cabbage patch]]. From the early days of ''RuneScape'', the cabbage has been renowned as a "wondrous source of brassican goodness", so the gnome child will need a freshly picked one to use as an artefact.

Go to the [[Falador farm|Falador cabbage patch]] (you can use the teleport of the [[Explorer's ring 2]] or higher for this without losing the gnome) and pick a cabbage. The gnome will take the cabbage (if not, make sure you talk to the gnome). Attempting to pick a cabbage from the Draynor patch triggers dialogue where the gnome child states he doesn't want that one. Talk to the gnome again, and he will tell you he has everything. Return to the [[Wizards' Tower]] to complete reopening the portal to the [[Realm of Memories]]. Speak to the gnome, and he will chant mysteriously to reopen the portal. After finishing the dialogue, you will step into the portal and get greeted by the gnome child, who will give you the event rewards. Feel free to look around in the realm and see several old graphics of monsters from the early days of ''RuneScape 2''.

'''Congratulations! Event complete!'''

==Trivia==
* Players who have completed [[Swan Song]] will protest to the [[Wise Old Man]] giving away his partyhat so easily to the [[Gnome Child]], saying that he didn't want to give the player his partyhat. The Wise Old Man will reply that he still might have held a more sentimental value to the party hat at that time.
** Players who have partially completed [[Swan Song]] will not even see the [[Wise Old Man]], instead talking to someone nearby to get the hat, which is not even the same hat that was stolen.
* Varying dialogue is also shown depending on the player's participation in [[2017 Christmas event]], [[A Tail of Two Cats]], [[Cook's Assistant]], [[Cold War]], [[Dragon Slayer II]] and [[Ernest the Chicken]].
*Despite being green in the event, the Gnome Child appears as normal on the login splash screen.
*The decorations in a few cities featured a single post that was examinable, with the examine text "What am I examining posts for?". This was done as a reference to commonly found posts in [[RuneScape Classic]],{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1350810260638986241|date=17 January 2021|archiveurl=https://archive.is/PtgpO|archivedate=17 January 2021|quote="That is the message you'd receive if you examined a lot of posts in RS Classic - we added it in a few places for this event, for those who have been around long enough to recognise the message."|notes=|name=|group=}} {{RSCL|Post|giving the same examine text}}. The other posts present in these cities were not be examinable.
